page.title: 14QUARRYING AT SHARPSTONES
page.content: Quarrying begins by drilling 16 holes in the rock, inserting gelignite and blasting. The{7OOO-1O,OOO}tons are removed by dumper truck to crushers to reduce size of rock. Each dumper costs {Â£45,OOO}and carries{45}tons. The tyres cost{Â£3,OOO}each. Various sizes of stones are stored in piles ready for selling, then are sent out on lorries. Special insulated lorries are used for tarmac loads to keep them warm. The quarry is worked from Monday to Friday 5a.m. to 8p.m., on Saturday from 6a.m. to midday and on Sunday from 7a.m. to 12 noon. The centre of the hill is quarried to 33 metres above sea level in three terraces. The type of stone is grey whacky gritstone. It is very hard and the best stone comes from the lower layers in the centre of the hill. This sedimentary rock is pre- Cambrian, the same as the{Longmynd.}
